question: The rights of forest dwellers are stated in which section of the Scheduled Tribes and Other Traditional Forest Dwellers (Recognition of Forest Rights) Act, 2006?
explanation: The rights of forest dwellers are stated in the section 3(1) of the Scheduled Tribes and Other Traditional Forest Dwellers (Recognition of Forest Rights) Act, 2006. The Act protects the rights of forest-dwelling communities, of land and other resources.
